```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
library(tabulizer)
library(shiny)
library(miniUI)
```

## Load all PDF files and use Tabulizer to extract data

```{r locate}

#First page
summary <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
enrollment <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
freshman <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")

#Second page
degrees <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
campus <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
libraries <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
faculty <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
tuition <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
grant <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
financial <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")
fund <- locate_areas("data/2018.pdf")

```


```{r import}

#First page
summary_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", page = 1, area = summary)
enrollment_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", page = 1, area = enrollment)
freshman_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", page = 1, area = freshman)

#Second page
degrees_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = degrees)
campus_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = campus)
libraries_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = libraries)
faculty_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = faculty)
tuition_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = tuition)
grant_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = grant)
financial_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = financial)
fund_data <- extract_tables(file = "data/2018.pdf", pages = 2, area = fund)

```
